content.description:
An nice fun climb that starts out as the second climb on the main wall. Jugs and ledges for the 2/3rds, than the angle eases and it becomes more slab/friction. The crux is after the first rap anchor, entering in to the slab. A lot of fun moves and easy clips. First section 5.8 and second section 5.10a. 2nd route/ line of bolts from the left end of the main crag.

Rap rings at a mid station for those wanting an easier warmup. 9 Bolts to midstation, two or three more to top station.
Rap or lower for descent.

Start straight up, then go right to the second bolt and continue to the top.

5 bolts, anchor with rappel rings on top

Steep and technical edges lead straight up the shield of olive colored rock. Requires perfect conditions in order to prevent your tips from spitting. An excellent Vancouver test-piece that has seen few repeats. 



Just left of where the approach trail meets the wall.  


8 Bolts with lower-off rings on top.

NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Follow the left bolt line but stay off the arete till the top. Trend left at the second bolt.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.


Bolts.

climbs.name: Asian Princess Got Devoured by Squeeterz

Start up the big flake on the right, pull into a crack, then weave left, right and left till the top.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.

Bolts

climbs.name: Asian Princess Hates Dinos on Crack

content.description:
NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Head right up the groove and clip a bolt on the bolder.

Mantle then head left slightly and then go straight up to the hand cracks at the top.

Avoid going out left.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.


Bolts.

climbs.name: Asian Princess KAPOWs the Sully's Bear

content.description:
NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Start under the bulge and go up the flakes on the left to the alcove. 

Finish up the slab.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.


Bolts. The chain for clipping at the crux to prevent a ledge fall.

Fun face climbing on good rock.
Another good addition to a popular crag.

This route starts and climbs to the left of little Lulu.
Bolted all the way

Technical stemming leads to a strenuous traverse, followed by an athletic jug haul.

7 bolts

Low-angle scrambling on bomber stone.

Just to the right of "the beginner"
6 bolts

Shares the first bolt with The Rookie but follow positive holds up right.

7 bolts, anchor with rappel rings

Crux is down low, first two bolts. Then you get a great rest, and you climb up a nice arete (fun!) 
 Pretty easy from there.

Right of Lubo, left of the projects.
7 bolts, anchor with rappel rings.

A good warm up climb for some of the harder routes at the crag, but also very popular because of the more accessible grade. This route splits into two different finishes. I feel like the right variation is a tad tougher. The grade is given as 10b, but I wouldn't have argued if it was listed at 10a...

On the right side of the crag. It starts in an obvious alcove left of the sheer face of In The Bubble.
Eight or nine draws to chains.

NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Head up the 2 bolts on the slab.

Go straight up the steep section.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.


Bolts.

Start up Dynamic Duo and then transition over to Trekking to India after the third bolt.

duo/india
8 bolts

This is one of the few routes at Sully's with a roof or overhang of any sort. It starts with a tricky broken face (stick clip not a bad idea) to an obvious roof. A few cool moves get your hands above the roof and a balancy step gets your feet above it. One more crux awaits near the top.

Just left of the obvious arete of Wingman.
Seven or eight draws to chains.

Easy climbing leads to a technical arete and a delicate(runout 5.9) finish on the far right side of the crag. Watch your rope path and stay just left of the arete once up there. This is a new route so there may still be some loose and brittle rock in some places. Helmets recommended. Far right side of sullies. The obvious arete.
The route starts about 3-4 meters right of the bubble. bolted

Hard / Sustained / pumpy. Start up to the diagonal ledge and traverse left. Powerful moves around the 2nd bolt. Technical crux above the 5th bolt.

Several feet right of the Special K crack.
6 bolts

Join Hindu Two Routes at the third bolt. The hardest part is the bottom.

Just right of Special K crack.
6 bolts

This is a thin fairly technical short route that is challenging from start to finish. A few holds have broken off, but the route still maintains its character and difficulty.

The furthest right route at the crag.
Bolts with chain anchors

climbs.name: It's Wong to Yum Yum Chum Chum !!!

content.description:
NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Clip a bolt on the slab, go straight up to the flakes on the overhang and then up a crack on the left.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.


Bolts, there is a chain at the 3rd crux bolt for easier clipping for shorter people.

Furthest left route on the crag.

Top of North Wall
5 bolts with rings at top

Fun start to the first bolt up the left side of a wide crack. Crux is at/after the last bolt. The rock has lots of texture. Again look for the marker on the rock. Second line of Bolts on the left and most north end of the crag 5 Bolts, with Rap rings at the top.
Rap or Lower off

Climb the steeper start to gain a somewhat lower angle slab above.

Leftmost climb on the Centre Wall
9 bolts, anchor with rappel rings

One  of the best routes at this Crag. It has three delicate cruxes separated by rests.

Follows a right trending seam, just right of 3M, to a smooth vertical face and then up thin section as it rounds out to the top.
7 bolts, anchor with rappel rings.

climbs.name: Marcus The Gopher Slayer
climbs.fa: Marcus T, E Tran, Jess C

content.description:
NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Start up the right side of the obvious roof bulge and go straight up to the left facing corner.

Don't go into the neighbouring climbs to the right or left.

Finish up the slab.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.

Bolts.
Climb a short, uninviting slab to a large ledge This route starts just right of Back Door Party​. 4 bolts, rap rings

This climb starts with some jagged holds up to prominent crack at the second bolt. Pulling through the crack to the third bolt is the crux and while the bolts are close together it still feels committing to get into the crack. The remainder of the climb is easier, but can feel hard if the crux left you pumped since nothing feels totally secure.

Straight in front of you when you emerge from the trail.
Seven or eight bolts to chains. Yes, there's a bolt beside a crack. Despite that, if you had a tight-hands sized cam it wouldn't hurt to throw it in.

Start in the corner, climb up past two bolts and continue up the slab section

In the corner on the North Wall
6 bolts, anchor with rappel rings.

Starts behind a large tree that has been pruned to make space for this climb. It is bolted well to prevent hitting the tree during a fall.  
 A great climb with one crux down low and another challenge at the finish with a really nice pump building up in between. One of my favorite routes at the crag.

This route is in the middle of the crag, just to the right of Shake Your Lettuce.
bolts with chain anchors

A corner climb that's harder than it looks from below. This climb requires creative footwork and clever use of underclings and pinches. Some days it feels easy, some days hard.

A prominent left-facing corner that starts low-angle and steepens to vertical. It starts about 30 feet left of where the approach trail meets the crag.
7 bolts, anchor with rappel rings.

NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Follow the line by the arete.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left as in pics below.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.

Bolts and chains.

NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Start off ledge, boulder moves to start then easy climbing.



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.


Bolts. There is a chain to reinforce the crux bolt.

Crack climb to the fourth bolt, followed by technical ending through the end, with the crux up high. Good rests after tricky sections.

In a crack to the right of Serene
7 bolts

Scramble up the mossy pedestal (3rd class), or walk around to the left and start on the small ledge. Climb the fun weathered pinches and jugs to the 4th bolt, then power through the bouldery finish making a tough 5th clip. 
 (quoted directly from SquamishClimbing.com)

Right of the projects. Rap rings
5 bolts

Delicate climbing on crimpers up the moderately overhanging face to the right of dynamic duo. Sustained and solid in the grade, joins french connection for the last 4 bolts. Crux comes passing the second bolt negotiating marginal crimps and poor feet to a "jug". Apparently this route doesn't get a lot of traffic but is worth a burn, especially if the more popular routes are getting crowded.

Located on the south wall area, climber's right of the large chasm on the right of the approach trail. Follows the first bolt line on the blank-looking, slightly overhanging wall to the right of dynamic duo.
9 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor with rap rings.

The best route at the crag. It pulls out onto a balancy arete with a great airy feel. The crux consists of some delicate moves left of the arete after a bit of a pump has set in. Though-provoking and physical climbing.

This is the most prominent arete at the crag, a bit right of the approach trail.
Six or seven bolts to chains.

NOTE

- This is a new crag. There may be grit and loose rocks still. Wear a helmet and do not loiter in the area. Be careful bringing kids and pets here.

- If the developers need to do further work, please vacate the climbs if they request such.

- First Ascencionists get to jump any line on their climbs!!!

Start from the obvious huge undercling and reach for the shelf above. Dyno might be required.

Continue straight up the slab (do not go right or left into the neighboring climbs).



This is a new Sully's crag named SULLY'S BEAR ASIAN BUFFET

- Go to the far left of Sully's Hangout. 

- Look for the path out left.

- Keep away from the wall as you head up as there is deadfall around it. Head out left then back right to the crag. The path is easy to follow.


Bolts.

A good Warmup to the left of 'Lefty'
Lots of Jugs on an off vertical face. Which provides another moderate to climb if the others are busy.
Not listed on the PDF Topo.

2nd left most climb on the North section of the crag
7 bolts with rap rings at the top.

Located on a heavily forested mountainside, Sullys does not really receive any direct, open sunlight. It is shady and coola better place than most to climb on a sweltering sunny afternoon. Also, because it faces west, Sullys benefits in the late afternoon and early evening from about as much sunlight as can be expected  
  
 Sullys can be very slow to dry out after a rain, especially in the spring and fall.  
  
 It is a good place to go after work but the size of the crag and proximity to Vancouver can leave it crowded. 
  
 Sport climbingall boltedat a variety of grades. There are some excellent moderates, but the crag tends to feature difficult and bold sport routes that are very challenging for the average weekend warrior. Whatever the grade, the climbing is always interesting. In places, the rock is highly featured and varies from slab to overhanging with fractures, cracks, and even roofs thrown in for good measure.  There is about 25 routed in total. 
  
 A topo can be downloaded here 
  squamishclimbing.com/topos/… 
 also you can find the topo on the quickdraw publications website. 
  
 Not on the topo: 2 additional 5.9s on the North area, beside "lefty" and a 5.7 as well. 
  
 A lot of the routes have the name and grade written on the rock in Black marker(insert ethical discussion here), some of the grades on the rock are different than the topo.  
  
 This description has been compiled from the topo and Squamishclimbing.com as well as my own observations..
